column3: STUDY GUIDE (link to Wiki version on authors)
column6: RELATED LESSONS (People's Physics don't have Lessons, so all belong to L1)
column9: DESCRIPTION
column10: RELATED CK-12 CHAPTER (link to Wiki version on authors)

column8: SCI.PHY.121.L.1, SCI.PHY.123.L.1, SCI.PHY.124.L.1, SCI.PHY.130.L.1, SCI.PHY.120.L.1, SCI.PHY.120.L.1, SCI.PHY.162.1.L.1
column9: A review of the terms distance, displacement, velocity, speed, and acceleration. Also looks at graphs of motion, using the kinematic equations, projectile motion, and free fall.

column8: SCI.PHY.142.L.1, SCI.PHY.143.L.1, SCI.PHY.149.L.1, SCI.PHY.147.L.1, SCI.PHY.146.L.1, SCI.PHY.141.L.1
column9: Looks at Newton's three laws, free body diagrams, and types of forces, including the force of gravity, normal force, and friction force.
Overview of potential energy, kinetic energy, and energy conservation, as well as energy diagrams, work, conservative force, and non-conservative force.
Reviews momentum, law of conservation of momentum, impulse, and collisions (perfectly elastic and perfectly inelastic).

column8: SCI.PHY.163.L.1, SCI.PHY.163.1.L.1, SCI.PHY.163.2.L.1, SCI.PHY.163.3.L.1, SCI.PHY.260.L.1, SCI.PHY.260.1.L.1, SCI.PHY.264.L.1, SCI.PHY.267.L.1
column9: Overview of circular and rotational motion: centripetal force, discussion of fictitious force, calculating period and frequency, determining the rotational axis, calculating angular quantities, and precession.
A look at gravitation, Kepler's laws of planetary motion, and satellite motion.
A review of simple harmonic motion: restoring force, period, frequency, and damped/driven harmonic motion. Also looks at spring system and pendulum system.
Overview of special relativity and general relativity: a look at time dilation, length contraction, relativistic mass and kinetic energy, twins paradox, and spacetime.

column8: SCI.PHY.310.L.1, SCI.PHY.311.L.1, SCI.PHY.317.L.1, SCI.PHY.325.L.1, SCI.PHY.320.L.1, SCI.PHY.318.L.1
column9: Overview of mechanical waves and the characteristics of transverse waves and longitudinal waves. Also looks at wave interaction: interference (constructive and destructive), beat frequency, standing wave, resonance, and the Doppler effect.
Overview of the laws of thermodynamics and heat engines. Looks at the ways heat transfers, specific heat, and thermal conductivity.

Brief overview of the properties of fluids: pressure, Pascal's law, Archimedes' principle, the continuity of fluid flow, Bernoulli's equation and conservation of energy, surface tension, viscosity, and turbulence.
Brief overview of radiation.

A review of electrostatics: Coulomb's law, properties of charges, electric field, conductive materials (conductors, insulators, semiconductors, superconductors), and charging by conduction or induction.

column8: SCI.PHY.430.L.1, SCI.PHY.434.L.1, SCI.PHY.442.L.1, SCI.PHY.444.L.1, SCI.PHY.445.L.1, SCI.PHY.446.L.1, SCI.PHY.448.L.1, SCI.PHY.437.L.1
column9: Overview of circuits and circuit diagrams. Also discusses voltage, current, Ohm's law, loop rule, and junction rule. Reviews how to solve resistors in series, resistors in parallel, capacitors in series, and capacitors in parallel.

Review of electromagnetism concepts:  magnetic field and field lines, first right hand rule, magnetic flux, solenoid, electromagnetic induction, force on charged particle, second right hand rule, and inductance.
A look at geoemtric optics: reflection, refraction, Snell's law, total internal reflection, ray diagram, real and virtual images, mirrors, and lenses.
Review of light's behavior as a wave (interference, diffraction, and Doppler effect).

column1: As of now, these guides are not associated with any CK-12 chapters.

column9: Brief introduction to Hooke's law and elasticity, stress, strain, elastic modulus, and plasticity.
Examples of some basic Gauss's law problems.
A look at some optical instruments: eye, telescope (reflection and refraction), microscope, and camera.
